channel.title: Zachary Yaro's Latest Math-On-Computer Tutorials
channel.description: Tutorials by Zachary Yaro that teach you to do math on your computer!

description.p: The most-searched tutorial on this site is still the one for inserting a triangle symbol in Microsoft Word, which has been outdated for ages, so that one, specifically, has received an update. This does not mark the return of me writing math-on-computer tutorials, but I hope all the folks searching for help using triangle symbols in Word find it helpful!

item.title: Major Update: Another move and retheming

description.p: The site stopped being updated last year after Verizon cut off my FTP access (the way in which I accessed and updated the site's files). If you have been following my Blog-Like News Feed or Google+, you know I have gradually been moving to hosting my site myself at zmyaro.com.

As of today, the Math-On-Computer Tutorials site is now 100% live at zmyaro.com/comp/math. In addition, I took the move as an opportunity to make some major updates to the site. In addition to rejiggering some of the content and some code under-the-hood, the entire site has a new visual style more similar to the rest of my website.
I hope you like these changes and look forward to bringing you new tutorials (*cough*GoogleDocs*cough*) in the relatively near future.

item.title: Update: Bug fixes and Windows 7
item.description: I have re-written the blue boxes so they now work in all browsers. I have also updated most tutorials for Windows 7 and Windows Vista since so many people have switched.
